name: KubernetesManifest
description: Use Kubernetes manifest files to deploy to clusters or even bake the manifest files to be used for deployments using Helm charts
author: Microsoft Corporation

inputs.name: action
inputs.label: Action
inputs.helpMarkDown: Choose the action to be performed.

inputs.name: namespace
inputs.label: Namespace
inputs.helpMarkDown: Sets the namespace for the commands by using the â€“namespace flag. If the namespace is not provided, the commands will run in the default namespace.

inputs.name: strategy
inputs.label: Strategy
inputs.visibleRule: action = deploy || action = promote || action = reject

validation.message: Enter valid percentage value i.e between 0 to 100.

inputs.name: manifests
inputs.label: Manifests
inputs.visibleRule: action = deploy || action = promote || action = reject

inputs.name: imagePullSecrets
inputs.label: ImagePullSecrets
inputs.helpMarkDown: ImagePullSecret to pull image from private registry

inputs.name: resourceFileToPatch
inputs.label: File path
inputs.helpMarkDown: Path to the file used for patch

inputs.name: kind
inputs.label: Kind
inputs.helpMarkDown: Kind of K8s object; deployment, replicaSet etc.

inputs.name: replicas
inputs.label: Replica count
inputs.helpMarkDown: Number of replicas to scale to

inputs.name: mergeStrategy
inputs.label: Merge Strategy
inputs.helpMarkDown: The type of patch being provided; one of [json merge strategic]

inputs.name: secretType
inputs.label: Type of secret
inputs.helpMarkDown: Create/update a generic or docker imagepullsecret. Select dockerRegistry to create/update the imagepullsecret of the selected registry. An imagePullSecret is a way to pass a secret that contains a container registry password to the Kubelet so it can pull a private image on behalf of your Pod.

inputs.name: secretName
inputs.label: Secret name
inputs.helpMarkDown: Name of the secret. You can use this secret name in the Kubernetes YAML configuration file.

inputs.name: secretArguments
inputs.label: Arguments
inputs.helpMarkDown: Specify keys and literal values to insert in secret.For example, --from-literal=key1=value1 --from-literal=key2="top secret".

inputs.name: dockerRegistryEndpoint
inputs.label: Docker registry service connection
inputs.helpMarkDown: Select a Docker registry service connection. Required for commands that need to authenticate with a registry.

outputVariables.name: manifestsBundle
outputVariables.description: The location of the manifest bundles created by bake action

messages.NotAValidSemverVersion: Version not specified in correct format. E.g: 1.8.2, v1.8.2, 2.8.2, v2.8.2.
messages.ManifestFileNotFound: No manifest file(s) matching %s was found.
messages.KubernetesServiceConnectionNotFound: Kubernetes service connection details not found.
